III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 02/15/2025 around 3:00 PM youth got upset and flipped a
chair and then ran to her bedroom where she was not supposed
to be. Staff began taking things out of her room and youth went to
grab some of her items. Multiple unknown staff members started
pulling on youth's limbs, spreading her arms and legs. Youth
squirmed to get away and one staff member pushed her to the
ground hurting her leg. Youth has an unusual, shaped bruise
about three inches by three inches on her outer right thigh and a
small round bruise on her inner left forearm from being pushed
down and improperly restrained.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 02/28/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 02/27/2025 at Vista Maria with
another Department of Health and Human Service (DHHS)
Worker. Youth A stated a staff (does not recall who) was doing a
visit with a youth and another staff (does not recall who) was on
break and she was on the unit alone with Supervisor 1. Youth A
stated Supervisor 1 told her that she could not go to her bedroom
(Myriam Hall room 102) “to chill”. Youth A stated she became
“mad” and went to her bedroom without permission. Youth A said,
“lots of stuff happened” and an assistance call occurred. Youth A
stated she did not want to talk further because she does not like
talking about the past. Youth A recalled another Division of Child
Welfare Licensing (DCWL) Consultant took pictures of her
bruises. Youth A stated the bruise on her leg healed and did not
mention the bruise on her arm. The other DCWL Consultant took
the pictures on 02/19/2025. It showed Youth A with a pale purple
bruise near the center of her left upper thigh and a pale purple
2

bruise near the middle of the underside of her left forearm. The
other DCWL Consultant stated the bruises were faint and barely
visible when she took the pictures.
Youth B was interviewed on 03/04/2025 at Vista Maria. Youth B
stated Youth A has a history of screaming and tantrums and did
this during Youth B’s most recent family visit on 02/15/2025. Youth
B stated she heard Youth A yelling, screaming and running
around the unit. Youth B stated she heard staff (does recall who)
redirect Youth A to use her words and asked her what was going
on. Youth B stated she does not know what prompted this incident
or how the incident ended because she was in another room for
her family visit.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 02/27/2025 at Vista Maria with Vista
Representative and another DHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated she was
cleaning up the common area when Youth A asked to go to her
bedroom. Staff 2 stated Supervisor 1 told Youth A that staff was
not available to be with her in the bedroom hallway. Staff 2 stated
she suggested the media room to Youth A, but Youth A refused
and started to scream about wanting to go to her bedroom. Staff 2
stated Youth A began to walk back and forth in the common area
and then walked to the bedroom hallway. Staff 2 stated she left
Youth A with Supervisor 1 to monitor a youth’s family visit.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 02/27/2025 at Vista Maria with
Vista Representative and another DHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
stated Youth A chose not to attend the craft activity in another
building and remained at Myriam Hall on 02/15/2025. Supervisor 1
stated Youth A requested to go to her bedroom and Supervisor 1
explained to Youth A that staff was not available to supervise her.
Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was given the option to go to the
media room (room adjoining the common area and provides line
of sight access) or wait to go to her bedroom after staff finished
supervising another youth’s visit. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A
started to scream without words and walked to the bedroom area.
Supervisor 1 stated she heard Youth A “trashing her room” and
kicking the walls. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A did not respond to
redirection, threw her personal belongings in her bedroom and
stood on her desk. Supervisor 1 stated Staff 1 came to Youth A’s
bedroom to assist. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A swung something
and this led Supervisor 1 to start clearing out Youth A’s bedroom
for safety. Supervisor 1 stated assistance was called when Youth
A tried to prevent having her personal items removed from her
bedroom. Supervisor 1 stated Supervisor 2, Staff 6 and other staff
responded to the assistance call. Supervisor 1 stated she and
3

Staff 1 secured Youth A in a two-person standing hold until Youth
A dropped down to the ground. Supervisor 1 stated Supervisor 2
cleared out a box from Youth A’s room and Youth A tried to get
this box, which led to Supervisor 1, Staff 1 and Staff 3 attempt to
physically manage Youth A. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A went
down to the ground on her knees and hands and was not
physically managed. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A eventually went
to her bedroom once her bedroom was cleared of personal
belongings and Staff 6 spoke with Youth A until Youth A fell
asleep. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A received her personal items
back on either 02/15/2025 or 02/16/2025.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 02/27/2025 at Vista Maria with Vista
Representative and another DHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated she
returned from break and heard screaming in Myriam Hall. Staff 1
stated she found Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 clearing out Youth A’s
bedroom while Youth A stood on her desk. Staff 1 stated Youth A
flailed her arms, kicked and tried to get a box from Supervisor 1
and Staff 3. Staff 1 stated Supervisor 1 called for assistance. Staff
1 stated she and Supervisor 1 placed Youth A in a two-person
standing hold and released Youth A when she maneuvered
herself to the ground. Staff 1 stated Youth A screamed and
focused on one of her boxes. Staff 1 stated Supervisor 1 and Staff
3 redirected Youth A and asked Youth A what she wanted from
the box. Staff 1 stated Youth A was given a blue stuff animal from
the box and she began to settle down. Staff 1 stated Supervisor 1
and Staff 3 continued to clear out Youth A’s bedroom while she
watched and followed Youth A around Myriam Hall. Staff 1 stated
Supervisor 2 also responded to the assistance call and
encouraged Youth A to talk.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 02/28/2025 by phone. Staff 3 stated
Youth A screamed and threw items in her bedroom when she was
unable to take a time out in her bedroom. Staff 3 stated she and
Supervisor 1 took an object (does not recall what it was) out of
Youth A’s hand that she was swinging. Staff 3 stated she and
Supervisor 1 tried to physically manage Youth A in Youth A’s
bedroom but Youth A maneuvered herself into a semi-seated
position on the ground and was not physically managed. Staff 3
stated she assisted in clearing out personal items from Youth A’s
bedroom for safety concerns. Staff 3 stated Youth A was allowed
to take a stuff animal and her dad’s obituary from a box to help her
settle down. Staff 3 stated Team Lead talked with and de-
escalated Youth A.
4

Team Lead was interviewed on 02/27/2025 at Vista Maria with
Vista Representative and another DHHS Worker. Team Lead
stated she responded to an assistance call when Youth A tried to
prevent staff from removing items, such as a box and stuff
animals, from her room. Team Lead stated Supervisor 2 raised a
box in her hands to prevent Youth A from accessing it. Team Lead
stated youth A grabbed Supervisor 2’s arms while screaming as
staff redirected Youth A and told her that her belongings would be
returned. Team Lead stated Youth A was physically managed by
two staff (does not recall who) that stood on each side of her.
Team Lead stated Youth A was released when she maneuvered
herself to a seated position on the ground. Team Lead stated
Supervisor 2 exited Youth A’s bedroom with the box and Youth A
crawled out of her bedroom after Supervisor 2. Team Lead stated
she remained in Youth A’s bedroom and assisted in clearing out
Youth A’s personal items.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 02/27/2025 at Vista Maria with
Vista Representative and another DHHS Worker. Supervisor 2
stated she responded to an assistance call and found Youth A
upset and crying because her bedroom was being cleared of her
personal belongings. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A stepped out of
her bedroom into the bedroom hallway and tried to grab her
personal belongings. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A wanted
something from the box in Supervisor 2’s hands. Supervisor 2
stated Youth A was not physically managed for trying to get the
box and Supervisor 2 placed the box in the supervisor office.
Supervisor 2 stated she returned to Youth A’s bedroom to help
clear out her bedroom. Supervisor 2 stated she left Myriam Hall
when Team Lead talked with Youth A.
Staff 5 was interviewed on 02/28/2025 by phone. Staff 5 stated
she responded to an assistance call and found Youth A yelling as
her bedroom was being cleared of personal belongings. Staff 5
stated staff (does not recall who) redirected Youth A to calm down
and Staff 5 asked Youth A what was going on. Staff 5 stated
Youth A was upset because she wanted personal time in her
bedroom but was unable due to staffing needs. Staff 5 stated she
left Myriam Hall while Supervisor 1 spoke with Youth A. Staff 5
stated she did not witness or participate in physically managing
Youth A in this incident.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 02/28/2025 by phone. Staff 4 stated
she responded to an assistance call and found Youth A screaming
and throwing things in her bedroom. Staff 4 stated Youth A left her
bedroom, went to the kitchen, turned on the garbage disposal and
5

went back to her bedroom. Staff 4 stated she and several staff
(does not recall who) were in the kitchen moving items out of
Youth A’s reach. Staff 4 stated she did not know the reason Youth
A’s bedroom was being cleared of personal belongings. Staff 4
stated she did not witness or participate in physically managing
Youth A in this incident.
Schedule Coordinator was interviewed on 02/27/2025 at Vista
Maria with Vista Representative and another DHHS Worker.
Schedule Coordinator stated she was working at Myriam Hall in
the office with the door open when she heard Supervisor 1 tell
Youth A that staff was not available to supervise Youth A in her
bedroom. Schedule Coordinator stated Youth A became upset
and started to scream and run back and forth on the unit.
Schedule Coordinator stated she assisted by moving plastic
dishes in the kitchen to the supply room to prevent Youth A’s
access to them. Schedule Coordinator stated she did not witness
or participate in physically managing Youth A.
Staff 6 is on leave. Attempts to reach Staff 6 by phone were made
on 02/28/2025, 03/03/2025, 03/04/2025 and 03/19/2025.
Messages could not be left for Staff 6. Staff 6’s telephone
message on 03/19/2025 stated the line is not in service.
Therapist was interviewed on 02/27/2025 at Vista Maria with
Vista Representative and another DHHS Worker. Therapist stated
she met with Youth A on 02/24/2025 and Youth A did not want to
talk about the 02/15/2025 incident. Therapist stated Youth A did
not allege she was improperly restrained or injured in the incident.
Therapist stated Youth A has a history of self-harm and is working
on coping skills and relationship building.
Video
02/15/2025 video footage on Myriam Hall was reviewed. Video
does not record sound and does not capture the inside of Youth
A’s bedroom.
The first video clip shows Youth A walk to her bedroom and is
able to enter because the door is not fully closed. Youth A exits
her bedroom, knocks over a wheeled office chair in the hallway
and tries to throw the office chair as she yells and stomps her feet.
Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 enter the bedroom hallway. Youth A
enters her bedroom. Supervisor 1 removes the office chair from
the bedroom hallway and Staff 3 leaves the bedroom hallway.
Staff 3 returns and opens Youth A’s bedroom door and Youth A
pulls the doorknob to prevent it from fully opening. Supervisor 1
6

returns, places her foot at the bottom of Youth A’s bedroom door
to keep it open and speaks with Youth A. Youth A exits her
bedroom yelling and leaves the hallway followed by Supervisor 1.
Staff 3 begins to remove items from Youth A’s bedroom.
Supervisor 1 and Youth A return and enter Youth A’s bedroom
and the bedroom door closes. Supervisor 1 opens Youth A’s
bedroom door and places a garbage bag of Youth A’s belongings
in the hallway. Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 have Youth A in a
standing two person hold in the bedroom doorway and release
Youth A when she maneuvers to the ground on her buttocks.
Youth A gets up and enters her bedroom.
Second video clip shows Youth A exits her bedroom and tries to
get something out of or get the box from Supervisor 2, who is
standing in the doorway and then moves into the hallway.
Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 attempt to place Youth A in a two person
hold but end up standing in between Youth A and Supervisor 2 to
block Youth A from Supervisor 2. Youth A swings twice without
connecting with Supervisor 2. Supervisor 2 raises the box up,
exits the bedroom hallway and places the box in an office. Staff 3
stands between Youth A and Supervisor 2 in the middle of the
hallway with her arms stretched out to the sides. Staff that
responded to the assistance call continue to clear out Youth A’s
bedroom. Youth A walks to the kitchen.
Third video clip shows Youth A and several staff in the kitchen.
Staff move kitchen items, such as a bread toaster, serving utensils
and dishes, into the supply room next to the kitchen. Youth A
walks back to the bedroom hallway with staff following. Youth A
appears calmer and not yelling and walks to the common area
with staff following.
Documentation
Supervisor 1 wrote an incident report. It states on 02/15/2025
Supervisor 1 offered Youth A time in the common area or media
room due to staffing assigned for a supervised visit and staff
breaks. Youth A yelled and went to her bedroom followed by
Supervisor 1 and Staff 3. Youth A threw things in her bedroom
and held the doorknob to prevent Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 from
entering. Youth A did not comply with redirection and climbed on
her desk and continued to throw things. Staff 1 returned from
break and called for assistance. Supervisor 2, Team Lead, Staff 4,
Staff 5 and Staff 6 responded to the assistance call. Youth A went
to the kitchen and Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, Staff 1 and Staff 4
followed to move items from the kitchen to the supply room. Youth
A continued to not comply with redirection. Supervisor 1, Staff 1
7

and Staff 3 cleared out Youth A’s bedroom as Youth A tried to
grab her items and bite staff. Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 physically
managed Youth A inside her bedroom and released her when she
maneuvered to the ground. Youth A de-escalated and processed
the incident with Staff 6. Supervisor 1 placed Youth A on close
observation until she could meet with Therapist.
Staff 1 completed a body chart of Youth A on 02/15/2025. It states
Youth A does not have new marks or bruises on her body.
Vista Maria’s behavior management policy states “To maintain a
safe environment for all Vista Maria clients and staff, behavior
management interventions are only used when a client presents a
danger to self or others. These interventions should only be used
when all other less restrictive behavior management interventions
(i.e., verbal de-escalation, therapeutic interventions) have been
explored.”
Vista Maria utilizes Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) – Nonviolent
Crisis Prevention Intervention. Staff physically involved with Youth
A in this investigation and their last CPI training in relation to the
date of this incident are listed below.
Supervisor 1 completed CPI training on 03/25/2024.
Supervisor 2 completed CPI training on 11/07/2024.
Staff 1 completed CPI training on 02/15/2024.
Staff 3 completed CPI training on 03/27/2024.
Tour
Upon entering Myriam Hall there are offices to the left and right of
the hallway in the foyer area. Moving forward is an open area that
serves as a multipurpose common area. This common area is
furnished with a desk, couches and a television. The dining room
is to the left of the common area with three circular tables and
chairs. A full kitchen and a storage room adjoins the dining room
to the left when facing the dining room from the multipurpose
common area. In the back right corner of the common area is a
media room. The top half of the media room walls facing the
common area are made of rectangular windows. Next to the
media room is a walkway leading to the bedroom hallway. Youth
bedrooms, youth bathrooms and a staff office line the bedroom
hallway.
8

Analysis The agency is found in compliance because interviews and video
review do not support the allegation that Youth A was pushed to
the ground causing the bruise to her left thigh and left forearm.
Video footage does not capture what occurred inside of Youth A’s
bedroom. It cannot be determined in this investigation when or
how Youth A obtained the bruises.
This incident quickly escalated from a staffing issue to monitor
Youth A in her bedroom to Youth A not being able to self-regulate
and manage her frustration and behavior. There was no inclination
that not allowing Youth A to go to her bedroom would unfold as it
did. The amount of time it took to resolve this and the number of
staff that responded would have allowed Youth A to be monitored
by staff in her bedroom. Thus, Youth A is to work on coping skills,
impulse control and building relationships.
Technical Assistance
Listed below are suggestions for staff that may have deterred this
incident from progressing.
1) Lock youth bedroom doors when youth is not in their bedroom
to prevent unauthorized access.
2) Unlock the bedroom door for youth when youth returns to
baseline.
3) Close and lock youth bedroom without the youth inside if
personal items need to be removed. Clear the bedroom of
personal belongings when youth is not present.
4) Supervisor could have monitored youth in the bedroom hallway
and reset limits with youth e.g. allowing youth 15 minutes in
bedroom before going to the media room or common area if
staffing needs remain.
5) Offer youth to have an item or two items from her bedroom for
use in the media room or common area.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
9
